dataset.dc:title: Tragelaphus eurycerus (Ogilby, 1837), a preserved specimen record of the Mammals (recent) dataset [ID: ZMB_Mam_105745 ]
dataset.dc:description: The Animal Sound Archive at the Museum fuer Naturkunde Berlin (German: Tierstimmenarchiv) is one of the oldest and largest worldwide. Founded in 1951 by Professor Guenter Tembrock the collection consists now of around 130 000 records of animal voices.
dataset.dc:contributor: Museum für Naturkunde Berlin – Leibniz Institute for Research on Evolution and Biodiversity, Berlin
dataset.dc:source: MfN Custodians (2017). MfN Zoological Collections - Mammals (recent). [Dataset]. Data Publisher: Museum für Naturkunde Berlin (MfN) - Leibniz Institute for Research on Evolution and Biodiversity.
